titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Richard Paul Mitchell collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Paige Minister and Jacob Olidort

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-11-17T15:38-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

change.item: Description of materials added by Paige Minister.

did.abstract: Writings, newspapers, magazines, journals, books, clippings, and other printed matter relating to the Muslim Brotherhood, Islamic culture and political movements, and conditions in Islamic countries. Also includes material related to US foreign policy and other global issues from the late 1970s.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Richard Paul Mitchell collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1977, with an increment received in 1986.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Began graduate work at Princeton University in the languages and history of the Near East

chronitem.event: Conducted research in Egypt through Fulbright and Ford Foundation grants
Instructor in the Department of Near Eastern Studies at University of Michigan
US Foreign Service officer in Washington, Yemen, and Kuwait
Received PhD from Princeton University with dissertation on the Muslim Brotherhood
Professor of history at University of Michigan
Published The Society of the Muslim Brothers
Served as associate director of the Center for Near Eastern and North African Studies
Died while conducting research at the American Research Center in Egypt (Cairo)
The Modern Middle East and North Africa, co-authored with Lois A. Aroian, published posthumously

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains material collected by Richard P. Mitchell, a professor and scholar of the history of the modern Middle East and North Africa, during the course of his personal and professional research. A large portion of the collection pertains to the history and the early years of the Muslim Brotherhood, a religious, political, and social organization founded in Egypt in 1928 by Hasan al-Banna. Despite having undergone serious government suppression in 1948, 1954, and 1965, the Muslim Brotherhood remains a large international political organization.

The Society of the Muslim Brothers Research File contains material gathered by Mitchell in Egypt from 1951 to 1956 while conducting research for his dissertation, later published as The Society of the Muslim Brothers by Oxford University Press in 1969. It includes rare publications from members of the Muslim Brotherhood, both official and unofficial, that date from 1934 to 1963. Also included are editions of the organization’s weekly newspaper, Al-Da‘wa; other limited circulation newspapers, including bound volumes of local press; pamphlets mourning the assassination of Hasan al-Banna; and other printed matter regarding the Muslim Brotherhood. In addition, the series contains copies of the journal Al- Muslimūn, which was published by Sa’id Ramadan, a prominent member of the Brotherhood. The items in this series are organized according to an alphanumeric system used and created by Mitchell. An inventory listing the titles of these items is located at the beginning of the series.

The remainder of the collection contains clippings, booklets, books, and other printed matter, mainly from the late 1970s and early 1980s, collected in the course of Mitchell’s work as a professor of history at the University of Michigan and his research leading up to the publication of The Modern Middle East and North Africa. The Geographic File, Subject File, and Arabic File contain Mitchell's newspaper clippings files that he organized by either subject or geographic location. They include clippings from English, French, and Arabic publications and cover topics such as US foreign policy, the Middle East, North Africa, and various other global issues from the late 1970s. These files have been arranged for the most part according to a printed inventory created by Mitchell, located in the Richard P. Mitchell File.

The collection also includes some of Mitchell’s personal writings and correspondence (Richard P. Mitchell File), writings from colleagues and other scholars in the field of Islamic and Middle Eastern studies (Speeches and Writings by Others), newsletters and publications from groups concerned with Middle Eastern and Islamic issues (Organizations File), copies of Arabic publications (Printed Matter and Oversize Material), as well as official US Department of State publications relating to the Middle East and other topics found in the clippings files (Printed Matter).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collection
relatedmaterial.p: Richard P. Mitchell collection on the Muslim Brothers (microfilm), Hoover Institution Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, conference materials, writings, and other material related to Richard P. Mitchell, his research, and his work at the University of Michigan. Also includes article summaries completed by Mitchell's student assistants and an index to Mitchell's clippings files. Arranged alphabetically by form, followed by miscellany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a typescript copy of a paper by Voll titled, "Islamic Dimensions in Arab Politics since World War II." Voll was the author of the introduction to the 1993 reprint of The Society of Muslim Brothers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a handwritten letter from Mitchell to an unknown recipient, written in Cairo, Egypt shortly before his death. In it Mitchell describes the changes he has observed in the city since he was last there.

did.unittitle: First Conference of Islamic Philosophy on Islam and Civilization file,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a notepad with handwritten notes, an invitation, program, conference agenda, and copies of papers presented at the conference. Titles of the papers found in this file include, "Tariq aleaql fi al-turath al'Islami" by Zaki Najib Mahmud, "Islam & Indonesian Culture" by H. A. Mukti Ali, "Iqbal Human Civilization" by S. Jafri, "Problems of Communication between Islamic Civilization & Europe" by N. Daniel, and "Muslim Practice and Modern Development" by Bernd Eisenblätter.

did.unittitle: Index to geographic and subject files,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes cross-references. It should be noted that this index does not include all the files found in the Geographic and Subject Files. In addition, some file names have been modified for clarity.

did.unittitle: Memo from Jeff Meadowcroft re religious terms and definitions,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article co-authored with Gilles Kepel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes index cards with titles of articles and works of interest to Mitchell's research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a "Stop Israeli Bombing of Lebanon" bumper sticker, a document from "Supporters of the Resistance" regarding an upcoming demonstration, a letter from MERIP requesting donations after their New York office was attacked in 1983, collected correspondence, and a memo regarding the American Research Center in Egypt Fellowships.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by author or title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains several articles by Crowe published by The Alicia Patterson Foundation. Topics include: policy regarding Saudi Arabia, Middle Eastern oil, the evolution of the Arab corporation, and the Shah of Iran.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Mitchell's handwritten comments and edits in pencil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Foster, Mark, " Libya: A Modern History [by] John Wright: A Critical Review,"
Goldberg, Elis, "Bases of Traditional Reaction: A Look at the Muslim Brothers,"
Hussain, Asaf, "Western Theoretical Approaches to the Political Order of Muslim States: A Critique,"

scopecontent.p: Includes a note by the author to Mitchell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of an article in Arabic with a handwritten translation in English.

did.unittitle: The Society of the Muslim Brothers Research Materials,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains books, pamphlets, and periodicals, mainly from Egypt and Syria, collected by Mitchell as source material for his book The Society of the Muslim Brothers. Many of these publications were written by members of the Muslim Brothers or were official publications produced by the group.

The bulk of the items in this series are arranged according to an alphanumeric system devised by Mitchell. The first letter stands for the type of item, GR for ghayr rasmī, J for jarīda, M for majalla, R for risāla, and U for eumumi. A detailed inventory of these items, created by Mitchell, is also included and appears at the beginning of the series. It should be noted that not all items listed in the inventory appear in the collection. Items are in Arabic unless otherwise noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a photocopy of a handwritten inventory of the Arabic books, booklets, periodicals, and other printed matter found in this series. It should be noted that not all material listed in sections J and M appear in the collection. Inventory is written in Arabic with English transliterations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains books in Arabic from the following writers, many of whom were members of the Muslim Brotherhood: Aḥmad Anas al-Hajjājī, ‘Abd al-Khabīr al-Hawalī, Aḥmad al-Sharabāṣī, Muḥammad Shawqī Zakī, ‘Abd al-Hakīm ‘Ābidīn, Muḥammad ‘Abd Allāh Sammān, Fatḥī al-‘Assāl, Al-Bahī al-Khūlī , ‘Abd al-Majīd al-Bājūrī, Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Alwā’ī, ‘Abd al-Raḥmān al-‘Īsawī, ‘Abbās Hāfiẓ, Kāmil Ismā‘īl Sharīf, Al-Sayyid al-Shūrbajī, Muḥammad al-ʻAmāwī, Jamāl al-Dīn ‘Iyyād, ‘Alī Shiḥāta Rizq, Fatḥī ‘Abd al-Hamīd, Muḥammad al-Ghazālī, Muḥammad Quṭb, Sayyid Quṭb,‘Anwar al-Jundī, Aḥmad Anwar al-Jundī, ‘Abd al-Qādir ‘Awda, Muḥammad Labīb al-Būhī, ‘Abd al-Raḥmān al-Bannā, Anwar al-Jundī al-Bannā, ‘Abd al-Bāsiṭ al-Bannā, Sa‘īd Ramaḍān, and Al-Sayyid Sābiq.
See inventory at the beginning of The Society of Muslim Brothers Research Materials for a more detailed listing of each item.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: No GR-62. GR-63 is listed as GR-62 in handwritten inventory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Arabic newspapers, including newspapers published by the Muslim Brotherhood and other limited publications; a file of clippings and other printed matter; and a file of material gathered for the appendices to The Society of the Muslim Brothers. Only files J-11 - J-294 listed in Mitchell's inventory appear in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings regarding Hasan al-Banna, pamphlets, copies of papers by others, and three issues of the periodical Al-Risāla. Also includes: Shahīd al-jāmi‘a Aḥmad al-Manīsī; Nūr ‘alā al-ṭarīq… by Sa‘īd Ramaḍān, Taqrīr: Jamā‘at al-tabshīr al-Islāmī wa-l-iṣlāḥ bi-l-Sūdān, al-markaz al-‘āmm, Umm Darmān, Al-Quds fī khaṭr bayn al-tahwīd wa-l-tadwīl al-Maktab al-Dā’im li-l-mu’tamar al-Islāmī al-‘āmm, Essentials of Islam: A Moslem Englishman Summarises His Religion by I.C. Evans, al-‘Aqīda wa-shakhṣiyyat rajul al-‘aqīda by ‘Abd al-Ra’ūf, "Facts About the Muslim Brotherhood" by Sa‘id Ramadhan, Min rasā’il al-jamā‘a: ‘Ibād al-raḥmān, al-nashra al-ūlā, “The Obstacles in Our Way” by Hasan al-Banna (typescript translation), al-Rajul al-ilāhī by Aḥmad ‘Abd al-Jawād Sālim, and Al-Shu‘ūb tuqaddim aḍwā’ ‘alā Filasṭīn ilā al-shabāb al-‘Arabī al-nāhiḍ fī dhikr yawm Filasṭīn al-ta’rīkhī 15 Māyū. Material in Arabic, French, and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a notebook with writing in English and Arabic, as well as Arabic articles from a folder labeled "appendices." Also includes two collated photocopies of the folder. This file is not described in Mitchell's inventory.

did.unittitle: J-218 - J-225, Al-Qāhirah, Al-Zamān, and Al-Miṣrī,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains loose pages that became separated from the above publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Only items M-1 - M-21 listed under the majalla section of Mitchell's inventory are found in the collection. These include copies of Al-Muslimūn, a monthly journal edited by Sa'id Ramadan, a leading member of the Muslim Brotherhood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains books and pamphlets containing official teachings and messages of the Muslim Brotherhood, including writings by the founder of the group, Hasan al-Bannā. Also includes writings by Muṣṭafā al-Sibā ‘ī, Al-Ikhwān al-Muslimūn, Sayyid Quṭb, Hasan al-Huḍaybī, Hasan Shaltūt, ‘Abd al-Mun‘im Aḥmad Ta‘līb, Al-Bahī al-Khūlī, and Sulaymān al-Nadwī. See inventory located at the beginning of this series for a more detailed listing of each item.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains books and printed material by Muḥammad ‘Abd Allāh Sammān, Aḥmad Anas al-Hajjājī, Abū al-A‘lā al-Mawdūdī, Nāṣir al-Dīn al-Albānī al-Sā‘ātī, Mas‘ūd al-Nadwī, Abū al-Hasan al-Nadwī, Kāmil al-Shāfi‘ī, ‘Abd al-Ḥalīm Maḥmūd, Zaynab al-Hakīm, Muḥammad Asad, Anwar al-Sādāt, Yaḥyā Aḥmad al-Darwīrī, Muḥammad ‘Abd al-Mun‘im Khafājī, Aḥmad al-Shirbāṣī, ‘Abd al-Mun‘im Shumays, Muḥammad ‘Alī ‘Alūba Bāshā, Muḥammmad Aḥmad al-‘Adwī, Muḥammad Hasan Aḥmad, ‘Alī ‘Abd al-Rāziq, and Muḥammad Fahmī al-Ṭamāwī. Also included are four volumes of Maḥkamat al-sha‘b (U-27 - U-31), Ha’ulā' hum al-ikhwān (U-39), and two copies of The Moslem Brethren by Isḥāq Mūsā al-Ḥusaynī, one of which is a bound typescript of a translation by John F. Brown (U-49 - U-50).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: All newspapers are in French unless otherwise noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newspaper from Tunisia, later changed to Le Renouveau.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issues are in French and Arabic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Produced by the political party Hizb Al-Istiqlal in Morocco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Algerian publication in French which began as an information bulletin that was circulated to resistance fighters during the Algerian War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, photocopies of articles, notes, pamphlets, booklets, and other printed matter arranged alphabetically by location. Material mainly in English, with some items in Arabic and French.

Groupings and file titles are based on Mitchell's index, located in the Richard P. Mitchell File, and his original file names; however, some file names have been modified for clarity. Not all files listed on the index appear in the collection. Also, not all files in the collection are reflected in the index. Files on China, Europe, and USSR originally listed under "Alphabetical Topic File" in Mitchell's index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes an article from Jeune Afrique.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains materials regarding Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and the Persian Gulf not yet sorted into subfiles by the collector. Also includes Background Information on Saudi Arabia produced by The Arab Information Center in New York and a poster of a map of Saudi Arabia produced by the Arabian American Oil Company with information on oil as well as different cities and towns in the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains various articles on other countries that did not necessitate their own file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles regarding relations between Israel and African states.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles mainly related to drought and famine which affected the countries of Senegal, Mauritania, Mali, Niger, Chad, and the Upper Volta in 1973 and 1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles on Ethiopia, Sudan, and Somalia. See also: Egypt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of "Major Trends in the Evolution of the Egyptian National Self-Image: 1900-1950" from Occasional Papers on the Middle East, number 14, and "Annotated Bibliography of the Geo-Political Considerations of Egypt: A Working Prospectus" by Carter Garber, which was written for a history class taught by Mitchell. Also includes several articles from the Egyptian Gazette and the Egyptial Mail.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains files from "Europe and the Middle East" listed in the alphabetical topic file in Mitchell's clipping file index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles related to Iran prior to the 1979 revolution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains the typescript "Political Organization in Iran Since 1945: From Dowreh to Political Party" by an unidentified author and "Middle East Paradox--The 'Beggar Rich'" from The New York Times Magazine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The majority of the articles are from 1973 and 1980, with three clippings from the 1960s and a photocopy of an article from 1906.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles relating to a Libyan airliner that was shot down over the Sinai Peninsula by two Israeli jet fighters on February 21, 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains several articles from French publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings related to Turkey, Greece, and Cyprus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes the files from the USSR file listed under the alphabetical topic file in Mitchell's clipping file index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, photocopies of articles, notes, pamphlets, booklets, and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject. Material mainly in English, with some items in Arabic and French.

Groupings and file titles are based on Mitchell's index, located in the Richard P. Mitchell File, and his original file names; however, some file names have been modified for clarity. Not all files listed on the index appear in the collection. Also, not all files in the collection are reflected in the index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes the booklets: Facts of Israeli Expansion Lebensraum, Israel in Reality, Israeli Expansionism, and Palestine: Illustrated Political History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a summary of a visit to the Middle East by A. T. Sullivan from July 4-August 9, 1974 describing his impressions of current Arab-Israeli relations, as well as a document titled, "The Present Stage of the Arab-Israeli Conflict" by Bernard Lewis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings discussing whether or not violence is ever justified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopies of articles related to Arab-Israeli wars in 1948 and 1967. Also included is the June 1973 edition of the magazine Middle East International.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains various clippings and photocopies of articles on the Arab-Israeli conflict. Also incudes a booklet titled The Role of International Law in Achieving Justice and Peace in Palestine-Israel by W. T. Mallison, Jr. and S. V. Mallison.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains notices and reviews of books related to topics represented in the Subject and Geographic Files. Includes a copy of the 1980 catalog for Schocken Books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes articles discussing the easing of hostilities between various countries and the U.S.

did.unittitle: "Energy: The Facts...the Fears...the Future," CBS News Special Report, transcript,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of a research paper discussing inter-Arab relations in the context of the oil embargo and the Yom Kippur War, which was written for one of Mitchell's classes. The title page containing the author's name and title of the paper is missing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These files are listed in Mitchell's index as "The Hostage Crisis."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains material from the file listed as "Foreign Reaction to the Hostage Crisis" in Mitchell's clipping file index.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains various articles related to the 1979 Iranian revolution. Includes an edition of Women and Revolution: Journal of the Women's Commission of the Spartacist League from Fall 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of Afrique-Asie from November 1979, other articles in French, and booklets produced by the Islamic Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of "Islamic Revivalism and the Search for Peace in the Middle East" by Eric M. Davis and "The Return of Islam" by Bernard Lewis. Also includes a typescript copy of the paper "Non-Muslims and the Islamic Revival" by William Hamblin, which was written for a history class taught by Mitchell and contains his written comments.

did.unittitle: "Modern Muslim Movements and the Political Order" by I. A. Abu-Lughod, typescript,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of the May 8-14, 1979 edition of the Executive Intelligence Review, as well as a copy of an Arabic magazine, pamphlets, photocopies of articles, and various clippings from Arabic and English publications. Also includes a copy of Gary S. Schiff's dissertation, "Religion and Political Legitimacy: Islam in Egypt 1952-1954," a copy of the script for a segment on Egypt from the BBC radio series Islam in the Modern World, and several handwritten English translations of articles originally written in Arabic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a an unidentified research department memorandum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains the articles "Anti Semitism in the Gilded Age: A Reinterpretation" by John Higham (1957), "Arab Antisemites' [sic] Nazi Model" from Patterns of Prejudice (1972), and a news clipping about the increase in anti-Jewish acts in the neighborhood of Williamsburg in Brooklyn, New York (1981).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes transcripts of excerpts from CBS Evening News with Walker Cronkite on September 17, October 1, and November 14, 1974.

did.unittitle: Relations with Arabs and Christians in the US,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains the pamphlets Jews in the USSR and Socialists and the Fight Against Anti-Semitism, as well as a news clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly contains clippings from 1982 to 1983. Also includes a photocopy of the booklet Civilization and Modernization by Dr. Ali Shariati.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains pamphlets and copies of two speeches given by John G. McLean, Chairman and CEO of Continental Oil Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains "Middle East Oil on New Terms: A Survey by the Economist" as well as a clipping regarding oil from The New York Times and a copy of the Congressional Record from June 13, 1966 titled, "The Role of Private Enterprise in the Economic Development of the Middle East."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of International Energy Problems, policy number 14, from the US State Department's Bureau of Public Affairs, dated July 17, 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles related to trade, loans, and other finance decisions made between various countries in response to a rise in oil prices.

did.unittitle: "The Oil Crisis: This Time the Wolf Is Here" by James E. Akins, Foreign Affairs,
"Oil and Security: Problems and Prospects of Importing Countries" by Edward N. Krapels,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes several pamphlets and the booklet U.S. Politics and Arab Oil: Some Nettles to Grasp by Elmer Berger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of a speech given at the Mid-East Institute's 1972 Annual Meeting by James E. Akins titled, "Evolving Relationships among the Oil Companies, the Oil Producing Governments and the Major Consumers: Confrontation or Cooperation?"

did.unittitle: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes articles regarding the Suez Canal.

did.unittitle: "Talk Given by Liston F. Hills, Former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Arabian American Oil Company (ARAMCO) to World Affairs Council, San Francisco, California, on February 15, 1974,"
Palestinians and the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes the May 1973 edition of Revolution Africaine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter from Mitchell regarding a proposal for a panel on pluralism during an American Historical Association meeting.

did.unittitle: The Pope and the Catholic Church,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles regarding the superpowers' reactions to the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan and the general uneasiness between European countries at the time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles regarding countries in the Middle East and relations with Great Britain, Japan, the United States, and the USSR.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a description of a course on Latin America as a Thrid World area and a typed summary of an article by Ernesto Laclau titled "Feudalism and Capitalism in Latin America."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings and several pamphlets, including two copies of the pamphlet American Interests in the Middle East. Also includes a transcript of the lecture "Analysis of Strategic Areas: The Middle East" by Department of State official Edwin M. Wright and "The Tripartite Declaration of 25 May 1950: A Cornerstone of American Policy toward the Arab-Israeli Conflicts" produced by the Arab Information Center in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many of the articles discuss Jimmy Carter and a 1981 Camp David summit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains pamphlets, brochures, and other printed matter produced by the Jewish National Fund and the Association of Americans and Canadians for Aliyah.

did.unittitle: Anti-Semitism and anti-Arabism in the US,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an article by Robert Alter regarding Catholic priest Daniel J. Berrigan's views on Israel given during a speech to the Association of Arab University Graduates on October 19, 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles regarding Egypt, Libya, Jordan, Lebanon, and Syria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains editorials, mainly related to issues in the Middle East, from The Washington Post, Christian Science Monitor, and The New York Times.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a flyer calling for volunteers for kibbutzim in Israel, a flyer from the Association of Israeli Students, and flyers calling for donations to the Middle East Appeal.

did.unittitle: Food crisis and aid to the poor,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly contains articles related to efforts by the United Nations, the United States, and other countries to aid the poor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopies of two articles from The New York Times: "Rights, and Wrongs" by Jahangir Amuzegar which discusses human rights in non-Western countries and "Sadat at Camp David" by James Reston.

did.unittitle: Husayn (Hussein) of Jordan's visit to the United States,
"Islamic Fundamentalism: Background file for new introduction,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings related to the 1973 attack on the Saudi embassy in Khartoum, Sudan. Includes a news release from the US Bureau of Public Affairs dated April 17, 1973.

did.unittitle: Meir of Israel's visit to the United States,
Middle East activities in Ann Arbor,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a pamphlet advertising a demonstration in opposition to the Shah of Iran, an editorial cartoon from The Michigan Daily, a flyer for the Young Socialist Alliance of Ann Arbor, and an unsigned petition calling for legislation to forbid the introduction of US forces into the conflicts in the Middle East.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles in Arabic and English about the President of Egypt Muhammad Anwar El Sadat's speech on May 15, 1981 in which he abolished martial law in Egypt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains various clippings about the Russian author and his writings, including a book review of his memoir The Oak and Calf: Sketches of Literary Life in the Soviet Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains three articles on world terrorism in response to embassy attacks and other acts of terrorism in Tehran, Iran; Tripoli, Libya; Kabul, Afghanistan; Islamabad, Pakistan; and Bogotá, Colombia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles relating to the treatment of women in Arab countries, China, and Pakistan. Includes an unpublished paper by Alf Andrew Heggoy titled "Cultural Disrespect: European and Algerian Views on Women in Colonial and Independent Algeria."

did.unittitle: United Nations and the Middle East,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two papers by William Fierman: "Uzbek Feelings of Ethnicity: A Study of Attitudes Expressed in Recent Uzbek Literature" and "A Soviet Uzbek Short Story as Mirror of Societal Conflict."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mainly contains newspaper clippings from Arabic publications, as well as other printed matter in Arabic. Original file names were written in Arabic script and have been transliterated. Arranged alphabetically according to the transliteration.

did.unittitle: Al-Sa'ūdīyah wa-iḥāth al-Masjid al-Ḥarām (Saudi Arabia and the events of the Grand Mosque),
Islamic world - Turkey, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Arabistan,
al-Dustūt wa-taṭbīq al-sharī'ah (constitution and application of Sharia),
Khutab al-ṣādāt wa-akhbār 'anhu (Muhammad Anwar El Sadat - speeches and news),
Ṣirā'āt wa-taḥaddīyāt (Islamic thought - conflicts and challenges)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newsletters, publications, and other material from organizations concerned with Middle Eastern and Islamic issues. Arranged alphabetically by organization.

did.unittitle: Ad Hoc Committee for Academic Freedom,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from the committee with a copy of an ad they ran listing the names of individuals who supported their campaign for academic freedom on the West Bank and Gaza. Richard Mitchell's name is listed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains mailings and publications produced by the ADC, including copes of the ADC Backgrounder, ADC Issues, and ADC Reports. Also included is the booklet Eyewitness to Israel's Terror in Lebanon: Summer 1982.

did.unittitle: The American Committee for Human Rights in Egypt,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from the organization titled, "Repression in Egypt: What U.S. Aid to Egypt Supports."

did.unittitle: American Professors for Peace in the Middle East,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains one bulletin discussing current issues in the Middle East.

did.unittitle: Americans for Middle East Understanding, Inc.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a mailing titled "Israeli Settlements in the Occupied Territories."

did.unittitle: Association of Arab-American University Graduates, Inc. (AAUG),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from AAUG president, as well as AAUG newsletters that discuss topics such as the 1982 Lebanon War and the Sabra and Shatila massacre, in addition to AAUG news.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains organizational statements, newsletters, bulletins, and other miscellaneous publications. Includes some publications in Arabic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "An educational, cultural, non-profit organization promoting better American-Arab understanding." Contains material in English and Arabic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains news bulletins of the PMOI, an exiled Iranian movement that opposes the Islamic Republic of Iran. The bulletin is described as "a weekly bulletin presenting the important political events taking place in Iran, and a brief account of PMOI stances." Also includes a copy of a letter titled, "Death to the Khomeini's Regime, Long Live Freedom" from the Supporters of the PMOI.

did.unittitle: Revolutionary Communist Youth Brigade (Ann Arbor chapter),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter urging people to join with the group in organizing an "All-Michigan Iran Day" to consist of a one day teach-in on the subject of Iran.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains periodicals, reports, booklets, books, and other printed matter mainly relating to Middle Eastern and Islamic issues from the mid to late 1970s. Arranged by type and then alphabetically by author or title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Produced by the Palestinian group Fatah.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monthly publication of the Muslim Brotherhood. Contains numbers 1-4 from 1976 and numbers 57-59 from 1981. See also Jarīda in The Society of the Muslim Brothers Research Materials series for earlier editions.

did.unittitle: American Near East Refugee Aid (ANERA) Newsletter,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents noe
scopecontent.p: Contains numbers 52, 54, and 59.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 3, numbers 1, 3, and 5 and volume 4, number 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 7, numbers 4-10.

did.unittitle: Islamic Studies, American Institute of Islamic Studies,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 1, numbers 3 and 4 and volume 2, numbers 4 and 5.

did.unittitle: The Journal, The Muslim World League,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 5, numbers 3 and 5; volume 6, number 2; and volume 7, number 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 5, numbers 7, 8, and 10; volume 6, number 2; and special issues 2 and 3.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains issues from Spring 1978 and Fall 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 1, numbers 5-12.

did.unittitle: Middle East Research and Information Project (MERIP) Reports,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Now published under the name Middle East Report. Contains number 71, "Iran: Crisis Update; Trade Unions; Agricultural Dependence;" number 72, "After Camp David: Egypt Confronts Peace;" number 75/76, "Iran in Revolution;" and number 88, "Iran's Revolution: The First Year."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains volume 1, numbers 1-4. Also includes correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Each publication contains English summaries of articles from Arabic language newspapers, in particular summaries of the editorials published in Al-Medina by the managing editor, Mohammad Salahuddin. Includes six issues.

did.unittitle: US Bureau of Public Affairs publications,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two bulletins containing the "official monthly record of United States foreign policy," one from July 1977 and one from October 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Topics include: foreign military sales, Palestine, the Middle East, human rights policy, energy, developing countries, the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, the United Nations, and Iran hostage rescue attempts in April 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "A quick reference aid on U.S. foreign relations primarily for Government use. Not intended as a comprehensive U.S. policy statement." Contains three issues from September 1975, March 1976, and May 1976.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Topics include: energy, the Middle East, Arab-Israeli relations, relations with Iran, international commodity policy, the United Nations, North Africa, oil, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), and human rights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains issue number 3, "U.S. International Energy Policy, October 1973-November 1975;" number 8, "Reform and Restructuring of the U.N. System;" number 11, "The Egyptian-Israeli Peace Treaty;" number 12A, "SALT II Agreement;" number 13, "Vienna Summit;" number 14, "Iran: U.S. Hostage Case to World Court;" and number 15, "World Court Rules on Hostage Case."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains issue number 12, "U.S. Policy in the Middle East, December 1973-November 1974;" number 16, "Encouraging Investment in Domestic Energy: Minimum Safeguard Price;" number 17, "Toward a Strategy of Interdependence;" number 25, "Conference on International Economic Cooperation (CIEC);" and number 70, "Soviet Invasion of Afghanistan."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains speeches from various members of the Department of State. Topics include: Africa, peace in the Middle East, Third World countries, energy, human rights, and political change.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two statements titled "Problem of International Terrorism" and "Human Rights Policy Review."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains interviews with Secretary of State Cyrus Vance on the television shows Meet the Press and the MacNeil-Lehrer Report, in which he discusses current issues in the Middle East.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Topics include: detente, peace in the Middle East, oil, Israel, United Nations vote on Zionism, the European Economic Summit, terrorism, Africa, Lebanon, SALT, Moscow radiation of US Embassy, Italy, arms control, human rights, and China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Topics include: the energy crisis, Africa, foreign policy, relations with Israel, and Sahel development.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Topics include: peace in the Middle East, Egypt-Israel relations, Africa, Europe, Latin America, policy regarding nuclear weapons, the proposed sale of Airborne Warning and Control Systems (AWOCS) to Iran, and foreign assistance programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a interim staff draft of a memo from the USICA (most likely the United States International Communications Agency).

did.unittitle: Transcript, "Khomeini Takes Iran," The MacNeil/Lehrer Report,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transcript of an episode featuring Jim Lehrer, Shahriar Rouhani (Khomeini representative), Stephen Solarz (Democratic Representative), Charlayne Hunter-Gault (correspondent), and Eric Rouleau ( Le Monde magazine).

did.unittitle: The International Energy Situation: Outlook to 1985, CIA report,
A Report to the National Security Council by Executive Secretary on United States Objectives and Programs for National Security, photocopy,
Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) II reports,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains material produced by the Department of State, including a special report and a revised special report on SALT II, as well as a glossary of terms and a document titled "SALT II: The Reasons Why."

did.unittitle: America's Purposes in an Ambiguous Age,
Foreign Policy and the Department of State,
United States Chiefs of Mission 1973-1974, supplement,
United States Foreign Policy: An Overview,
United States Foreign Policy: An Overview,
Middle East Institute, Middle East Problem Paper, number 25,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains "Egypt Under Mubarak" by Mohamed Hakki.

did.unittitle: Realities of the Middle East: A Report by Senator George S. McGovern to the Committee on Foreign Relations, United States Senate, 94th Congress,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In Arabic. Title translates to "In the Writings of the Islamic Renaissance."

did.unittitle: Middle East Arms Sales Proposals: Hearings Before the Committee on Foreign Relations, United States Senate, 95th Congress,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopies of pages 132-137.

did.unittitle: Nadvi, Sayyid Sulaiman, The Living Prophet, translated by Sayeed-ul-Haq (photocopy),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a translation of Nadvi's "Kutbat-e-Madras," a series of eight lectures delivered at Madras in 1925.

did.unittitle: Osman, Mohammed Fathi, Alssalafiat fi almujtamaeat al'iislamiat almueasira,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Title translates to "Salafism in Contemporary Islamic Societies." Contains a photocopy of pages 259-310.

did.unittitle: The Palestinian Issue in Middle East Peace Efforts: Hearing Before the Special Subcommittee on Investigations of the Committee on International Relations, House of Representatives, 94th Congress,
Priorities for Peace in the Middle East: Hearings Before the Subcommittee on Near Eastern and South Asian Affairs of the Committee on Foreign Relations, United States Senate, 94th Congress,
Rothermund, Dietmar, ed., Islam in Southern Asia: A Survey of Current Research (photocopy),
US Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, World Military Expenditures and Arms Trade 1963-1973,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newspapers and magazines published in the Middle East, the US, and Nigeria. Also included is a Syrian poster warning against the Muslim Brotherhood and a poster for a BBC radio show on Islam. Material in Arabic and English. Arranged alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains pages 5-8 only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Daily English-language newspaper published in Kuwait.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains issues from December 12, 1978; March 4, 1980; and March 11, 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Daily newspaper from Nigeria. Contains issues from June 3, 1973 and June 5, 1973. The Sunday publication is titled the Sunday Sketch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "The Independent newspaper" published daily in Nigeria. Contains issues from June 2, 3, and 5, 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Egyptian daily newspaper owned by the state. Front page contains a handwritten note to Mitchell regarding an article about the arrest of Jalal al-Din al-Hamamsy, an influential journalist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Stories that made headline news." Printed in Nigeria.

did.unittitle: International Herald Tribune, special issue "Focus on Turkey,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Poster for a BBC Radio 3 documentary series beginning May 6, 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Published by the Embassy of the Islamic Republic of Iran in Washington, D.C. Contains numbers 13-18 (August 27-October 1, 1979) and 22 (January 21, 1980) of volume 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two copies of the same issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A Lebanese newspaper printed in Beirut. Includes an interview with Mustafa Khalil, Prime Minister of Egypt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nigerian newspaper published daily, except Sundays. Contains issues number 284 (June 2, 1973) and 285 (June 4, 1973).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sunday edition of the Nigerian newspaper The Punch.

did.unittitle: Syrian poster warning against the Muslim Brothers,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In Arabic. Printed in Jersey City, New Jersey.
